newsitem.title: USA: Rochester Medical sees $3 mln FY97 loss.
newsitem.headline: Rochester Medical sees $3 mln FY97 loss.

text.p: Rochester Medical Corp said Monday it expects to report a net loss of $3 million in fiscal year 1997 ending in September, compared with a net loss of $1.4 million in fiscal 1996.

"The net loss will result from expenses associated with ongoing clinical trials and escalation of our preparation activities for market introduction of our new generation products," Anthony Conway, company president, said in a news release. "We expect to see the impact of those expenditures in fiscal 1998 and beyond when our new generation products begin to contribute to sales and earnings results."

The medical catheter maker said it expects sales from its two existing product lines to rise by more than 50 percent in fiscal 1997. The company Monday reported sales of $5.5 million for the year ended September 30.

"In most segments, including our strategic relationship with ConvaTec, we expect an acceleration in sales growth," Conway said. "We also anticipate that sales to certain large private label accounts will be comparable to last year."
Rochester Medical shares were up 7/16 at 17 Monday.
